post_text: Graduation
text:
Graduation

BELTSCHOOL.COM
Graduation

post_text:
The Class of 2020 will graduate on May 17, 2020 at 2:00 PM. The ceremony will be held on the football field. Chairs will be available for immediate family members. Other guests are encouraged to bring lawn chairs or blankets to sit on.
Social distancing guidelines will be followed by all participants and guests. We believe that having the ceremony on the football field will allow for community participation while ensuring safety through social distancing. Anyone over the age of 65 or who is identified as vulnerable per the CDC guidelines is discouraged from attending.
Following the Graduation Ceremony, please join us downtown for a celebratory parade!
text:
The Class of 2020 will graduate on May 17, 2020 at 2:00 PM. The ceremony will be held on the football field. Chairs will be available for immediate family members. Other guests are encouraged to bring lawn chairs or blankets to sit on.
Social distancing guidelines will be followed by all participants and guests. We believe that having the ceremony on the football field will allow for community participation while ensuring safety through social distancing. Anyone over the age of 65 or who is identified as vulnerable per the CDC guidelines is discouraged from attending.
Following the Graduation Ceremony, please join us downtown for a celebratory parade!

post_text: As we examine options for the end of the year that ensure the safety of all of our children, their families and our staff in light of this pandemic, we would appreciate your input. Starting May 7, the school will have multiple options for instructional delivery through the end of the year: continued distance learning, limited reentry, and a blended model. Please email us at beltfamilyconnection@beltschool.com and let us know your thoughts or comments. Thank you
text: As we examine options for the end of the year that ensure the safety of all of our children, their families and our staff in light of this pandemic, we would appreciate your input. Please email us at beltfamilyconnection@beltschool.com and let us know your thoughts or comments. Thank you

Let Us Know How We Are Doing
We would like to know how we are doing in providing distance learning and breakfast/lunches. I have set up an email account for you to give us feedback on how things are going at home. Mr. Paulson and I will be reviewing your emails and using that information to improve our processes. If you have an instructional or technical question, please email the teacher. This new email is only for feedback on how things are going for you. Please send us your comments at beltfamilyconnection@beltschool.com

It’s almost Science Fair time! Let me know if you would be willing to judge one or more of our fairs!

Belt School is looking for judges for the following Belt School Science Fairs. Would you be willing to help us out with one or more of the fairs?
If you are unavailable, do you know of anyone that may be able to help? Please contact me or Patty in the office at Belt School as soon as possible, if you can help.

Middle School Fair
Monday, February 17th
7:45-11:20 am

High School Fair
Monday, February 17th
11:30 a.m.—3:30 pm
(lunch is provided to you)

Elementary Fair (gr. 3-5)
Tuesday, February 18th
12:15-3:30
(Come at 11:45 if you want lunch—Lunch will be provided to judges.)

Debbie Vogt
Middle School Science Teacher
6th ELA Teacher
Gifted/Talented Coordinator
Belt School
school-406-277-3351

post_text: October 15, 2019, The secure in place has been lifted. Belt School will resume its normal schedule. The building and campus have been cleared.
text: October 15, 2019, The secure in place has been lifted. Belt School will resume its normal schedule. The building and campus have been cleared.

post_text:
October 15, 2019
Belt School is in secure in place until further notice. At this time, we have no reason to believe that there is an immediate threat; however, due to a threat this morning at Rossiter School in Helena, the Cascade County Sheriff;s department is checking all Cascade County Schools. We will remain in secure in place until the campus has been cleared by the Sheriff's office. Please do not come to the school. No one will be allowed in or out of the building during the secure in place.
text:
October 15, 2019
Belt School is in secure in place until further notice. At this time, we have no reason to believe that there is an immediate threat; however, due to a threat this morning at Rossiter School in Helena, the Cascade County Sheriff;s department is checking all Cascade County Schools. We will remain in secure in place until the campus has been cleared by the Sheriff's office. Please do not come to the school. No one will be allowed in or out of the building during the secure in place.

post_text: Did you know that our school collects Box Tops? You can help our school by either downloading an App or cutting Box Tops off hundreds of products. If you sign up for electronic submission, please select Belt Public Schools as your designated school. If you choose to cut Box Tops, please submit them to the school office. Mrs Jones will handle the Box Top submissions.
